page.title: 14Norwood Manor, Eastchurch
page.content: Norwood Manor, first known as Northwood Manor, was built in 1126 and remained a feature of the{local {history}until it was destroyed in {Cromwell's time}resulting in the building of the present{manor}house in about 1670. There is no record after the restoration but it is known that it has been continuously occupied through the years. Since the nineteenth century it has been a{farm}and remains so today. When damaged during the Second World War many of the original features were revealed. It is thought that most of the farms in the area once belonged to the manor. At present Norwood is owned by a syndicate who farm the land whilst the farmhouse is occupied by a previous employee.
